name: market for tin plating, pieces | tin plating, pieces | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4237/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'tin plating, pieces', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This is delivering the service of 'tin plating, pieces'. Tin plating is a multi-step process that includes alkaline and acid baths, rinsing processes, the so-called "nickel strike" and neutralisation baths in the end. The service includes material inputs, water and energy consumption, production infrastructure, emissions and waste treatment. Tin plating process is generally applied to protect basic materials from corrosion and friction. Tin`s main applications are the coating of steel for packaging of food, beverages, aerosols, printed circuit boards, electric connectors, appliance chassis, kitchen utensils, alkaline battery jackets, etc.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
